clinical_study.brief_title: Gene Expression in Patients With Epiretinal Membranes
clinical_study.official_title: Gene Expression and Their Correlations in Patients With Idiopathic and Secondary Epiretinal Membranes in Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy

collaborator.agency: Department of Molecular Biology, Medical University of Silesia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate the expression of selected genes both in epiretinal membranes (ERMs) and peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) from patients with primary and secondary epiretinal membranes in proliferative diabetic retinopathy. Possible correlations between messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) levels of these genes were also identified.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.measure: Gene expression in patients with idiopathic and secondary epiretinal membranes in proliferative diabetic retinopathy.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The period between the diagnosis of the ERMs and the actual surgery for the condition was between 2 and 43 months.

study_pop.textblock:
Study population description:
The blood and ERM samples were obtained from patients treated in the Department of Ophthalmology, University Hospital No. 5, Medical University of Silesia, Katowice, Poland.
All subjects underwent a complete ophthalmic examination: best corrected visual acuity (BCVA), tonometry, slit lamp examination of anterior and posterior segment, optical coherence tomography (OCT) of the central retina.
